intro: Gymnoluma ucuqui, commonly known as the Ucuqui plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Gymnoluma ucuqui is valued for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in treating various ailments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
